model.name: Matrix
model.php_template:
<?php

$handle = fopen ("php://stdin", "r");
fscanf($handle, "%i %i", $n, $k);
for($a0 = 0; $a0 < $n-1; $a0++){
    fscanf($handle, "%i %i %i", $x, $y, $z);
}
for($a0 = 0; $a0 < $k; $a0++){
    fscanf($handle, "%i",$m);
}

?>
model.ruby_template:
#!/bin/ruby

n, k = gets.strip.split(' ')
n = n.to_i
k = k.to_i
for a0 in (0..n-1-1)
    x, y, z = gets.strip.split(' ')
    x = x.to_i
    y = y.to_i
    z = z.to_i
end
for a0 in (0..k-1)
    m = gets.strip.to_i
end
model.haskell_template:
import Control.Applicative
import Control.Monad
import System.IO


main :: IO ()
main = do
    n_temp <- getLine
    let n_t = words n_temp
    let n = read $ n_t!!0 :: Int
    let k = read $ n_t!!1 :: Int
    forM_ [1..n-1] $ \a0  -> do
        x_temp <- getLine
        let x_t = words x_temp
        let x = read $ x_t!!0 :: Int
        let y = read $ x_t!!1 :: Int
        let z = read $ x_t!!2 :: Int
    forM_ [1..k] $ \a0  -> do
        m_temp <- getLine
        let m = read m_temp :: Int

getMultipleLines :: Int -> IO [String]

getMultipleLines n
    | n <= 0 = return []
    | otherwise = do          
        x <- getLine         
        xs <- getMultipleLines (n-1)    
        let ret = (x:xs)    
        return ret
model.preview: Destroy enough roads so no two machines are can reach each other. Find the roads to destroy in the least amount of time.
model.clojure_template:
(use '[clojure.string :only (split triml)])

(
    let [
      n_temp (read-line) 
      n_t (split n_temp #"\s+") 
      n (Integer/parseInt (n_t 0)) 
      k (Integer/parseInt (n_t 1)) 
    ]

  (
    loop [a0 n-1]
    (when (> a0 0)

      (
        let [
          x_temp (read-line) 
          x_t (split x_temp #"\s+") 
          x (Integer/parseInt (x_t 0)) 
          y (Integer/parseInt (x_t 1)) 
          z (Integer/parseInt (x_t 2)) 
        ]
      )

    (recur (- a0 1) ) )
  )

  (
    loop [a0 k]
    (when (> a0 0)

      (
        let [
          m_t (read-line) 
          m (Integer/parseInt m_t) 
        ]
      )

    (recur (- a0 1) ) )
  )

)
model.erlang_template:
-module(solution).
-export([main/0]).

main() ->

    { ok, [N,K]} = io:fread("", "~d~d"),
    N-1_list = lists:seq(1,N-1),
    lists:foreach( fun(N-10) ->
            { ok, [X,Y,Z]} = io:fread("", "~d~d~d")
    end,N-1_list),
    K_list = lists:seq(1,K),
    lists:foreach( fun(K0) ->
            { ok, [M]} = io:fread("", "~d")
    end,K_list),
    true.

read_array(0,D) -> [];
read_array(N,D) -> 
	{ok, [X]} = io:fread("", D),
	[X | read_array(N-1,D)].

read_2darray(0,M,D) -> [];
read_2darray(N,M,D) ->
	Q=read_array(M,D),
	[Q | read_2darray(N-1,M,D)].
model.lua_template:
n,k = io.read("*number", "*number", "*l")
a0 = 0
while a0 < n-1 do
    x,y,z = io.read("*number", "*number", "*number", "*l")
    a0 = a0 + 1
end
a0 = 0
while a0 < k do
    m = io.read("*number", "*l")
    a0 = a0 + 1
end
model.body_html:
The kingdom of Zions has cities and bidirectional roads. There is a unique path between any pair of cities.

Morpheus has found out that machines are planning to destroy the whole kingdom. These machines are initially living in different cities of the kingdom and they can launch an attack anytime. Neo has to destroy some of the roads in the kingdom to disrupt all connections among the machines. After destroying the necessary roads there should be no path between any two machines.

Since the attack may happen at any moment, Neo has to do this task as fast as possible. Each road in the kingdom takes a certain amount of time to destroy and only one road can be destroyed at a time.

You need to write a program that tells Neo the minimum amount of time he will require to destroy the necessary roads.

Input Format

The first line of the input contains two space-separated integers, and . Cities are numbered to .

lines follow, each containing three space-separated integers, , which means that there is a bidirectional road connecting city and city , and to destroy this road it takes units of time.

lines follow, each containing an integer. The integer is the id of the city in which the machine is currently located.

Constraints

Output Format

Print in a single line the minimum time required to disrupt the connection among machines.

Sample Input

5 3
2 1 8
1 0 5
2 4 5
1 3 4
2
4
0

Sample Output

10

Explanation

The machines are located at the cities 0, 2 and 4. Neo can destroy the road connecting city 2 and city 4 of weight 5 , and the road connecting city 0 and city 1 of weight 5. As only one road can be destroyed at a time, the total minimum time taken is 10 units of time. After destroying these roads none of the machines can reach another machine via any path.
